bdy.p:
Laura Hill (born 1975) is a New Zealand actress, best known for portraying the popular character Toni Thompson/Warner on the New Zealand soap opera,
Shortland Street . Born in England, she moved to New Zealand as a young child with her family.

Laura has a 1st Class Honours degree in English Literature from
Victoria University of Wellington , where she also majored in Theatre and Film.

While in
Wellington , Laura was involved in fringe theatre, performing in productions of Purple Frog and The Daily Grind.

She gained television acting experience in Duggan and Questions, a TV drama developed from a stage play dealing with youth suicide. She also worked in radio and at Playmarket, the scriptwriter's agency, before joining
Shortland Street in early 2001. Laura recently performed in Auckland Theatre Company's acclaimed production of the new
Roger Hall
play, Spreading Out.

Laura took a six month break from Shortland Street and returned to the series towards the end of 2007 and departed from the series in June when her character died. Laura had cited 'health reasons' when she took a break.
